memetic

evoalg.c File Reference

Detailed Description

Uses the evolutionary algorithm technique to find a fractal (represented by an L-System) such that the actual (x,y) data points are used as an instance of a Travelling Salesman Problem solved by the program Concorde and are relatively difficult to solve.

Concorde web site: http://www.tsp.gatech.edu/concorde/index.html

In order for this program to work you will need to obtain the source code for Concorde and replace the file concorde.c with mine (if it is not distributed with this file, check my website http://www.eng.newcastle.edu.au/~c3004154) then run make to compile and create the Concorde program.

This program runs Concorde by executing the command concorde. Make sure that concorde can be found in $PATH.

Author:
Farhan Ahammed (faha3615@mail.usyd.edu.au)

Function Documentation

int main ( int  argc,
char **  argv 
)

Starts the program.

Arguments are expected. Run the program like this:
<this program> <#functions in each pop> <#parents> <#generations>

All arguments must be integers.
<#generations> can accept a long number.

Parameters:
argc The size of the array argv.
argv The array of arguments passed to this program.
Returns:
0 If this program executed properly.
